Welcome to CNN-Music’s documentation!¶

Indices¶

  • Index

Model¶

model.get_model(x: numpy.ndarray, y: numpy.ndarray, parameters: Dict[str, Union[str, int]]) -> (<class 'keras.engine.sequential.Sequential'>, <class 'keras.callbacks.callbacks.History'>)¶
Parameters

  • x – list of the groups with selected size sequences

  • y – array of next values of each squence group

  • parameters –

    • dict with the model configs

Returns

A tuple with a model and history that can be used to generate graphs

model.get_model_inputs(int_notes: List[int], sequence_length: int) → Tuple[List[int], List[int]]¶
Parameters

  • int_notes – sequence of notes converted to integers

  • sequence_length – size of the grouped series

Returns

tuple with list of series groups, and next value to each group

Predict¶

predict.get_new_series(size: int, input, model, set_size: int) → List[int]¶
Parameters

  • size – the size of output series

  • model – a keras Sequential model

  • set_size – size of notes set

Returns

number series with length size

predict.predict_next(x_input: numpy.ndarray, model: keras.engine.sequential.Sequential, set_size: int) → int¶
Parameters

  • x_input – a time series

  • model – a keras Sequential model

  • set_size – size of notes set

Returns

the predicted next number on series

Get Notes and Chords¶

note.get_int_notes(pitchnames: List[str], notes: List[str]) → List[int]¶
Parameters

  • pitchnames – Set of sorted note names

  • notes – Sequence of note strings

Returns

List of integers representing the notes

note.get_note_strings(int_to_note: Dict[int, str], series: List[int]) → List[str]¶
Parameters

  • int_to_note – Dict to translate integers to note strings

  • series – Number series representing notes

Returns

List of note strings

note.get_notes(data_path: str) → List[str]¶
Parameters

data_path – path to midis directory

Returns

List of note strings

note.get_pitchnames(notes: List[str]) → List[str]¶
Parameters

notes – List of note strings

Returns

Set of sorted notes

Parameters

  • history – Model history

  • graph_desc – Dict with graph description
